metadata.title: CVE-2018-5094 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A heap buffer overflow vulnerability may occur in WebAssembly when "shrinkElements" is called followed by garbage collection on memory that is now uninitialized. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 58.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine chrisccoulson> This is not fixed in mozjs52, but it's unclear whether it is unaffected or just ignored as the bug is still private. See https://hg.mozilla.org/releases/mozilla-release/rev/2467d71d0e0d

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
